wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the korysmiditoolbox project. Explain its purpose as a web-based MIDI composition tool with AI-powered chord generation using Google's Gemini API. Describe the core functionality including interactive piano roll editing, real-time audio playback via Tone.js, and multi-format export (MIDI/WAV). Highlight key features such as localStorage persistence, dark/light theme support, and responsive design. Document the technology stack: Next.js 15, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and critical libraries like midi-writer-js and @google/generative-ai. Provide context on use cases for music creators and developers, and explain how this tool differentiates from traditional DAWs by combining AI assistance with intuitive visual editing. Include deployment model details (static site export) and security considerations around client-side API key handling.

wiki_catalogs.name: MIDI Fundamentals
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content introducing MIDI fundamentals as implemented in korysmiditoolbox. Explain the structure and purpose of the MidiNote interface including pitch (0-127 range), startTime (seconds), duration (seconds), and velocity (0-1). Detail how these properties are used in the piano roll editor and audio playback system. Describe the role of utility functions like getMidiNoteNumber and getNoteName in translating between musical notation and MIDI values. Illustrate with code examples from midiUtils.ts how note conversion and timing calculations are performed. Include diagrams showing the relationship between MIDI note numbers, octave positions, and visual representation in the UI. Address common issues such as timing precision, note overlap handling, and velocity interpretation in Tone.js playback.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the component architecture of korysmiditoolbox. Describe the React component hierarchy starting from index.tsx as the root, composed with layout components (Header, Main, Footer) and feature components (ControlBar, PianoRoll, SettingsPanel). Explain the separation between layout, UI primitives, and interactive music editing components. Detail how the PianoRoll component uses canvas-based rendering for performance-critical note visualization and user interaction. Document the composition pattern using React Context providers (AppProvider, ToastProvider) to inject state and services. Illustrate how UI components like Button and Toast are designed for reusability with TypeScript interfaces. Include examples of component props, event handling, and integration with global state via useApp hook. Address design decisions such as avoiding excessive re-renders through memoization and efficient canvas redraw strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: AppContext API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the AppContext in korysmiditoolbox. Detail the AppState interface including notes, playback state (isPlaying, currentTime), rootNote, scaleType, and settings. Document all dispatch actions with their types and payloads: ADD_NOTE, UPDATE_NOTE, DELETE_NOTE, SELECT_NOTE, CLEAR_NOTES, SET_ROOT_NOTE, SET_SCALE_TYPE, SET_PLAYING, SET_CURRENT_TIME, UPDATE_SETTINGS, and LOAD_STATE. Explain the useApp custom hook usage pattern and error handling when used outside of provider. Describe the defaultState initialization and localStorage persistence mechanism for both application state and user settings. Include code examples showing how components like PianoRoll and ControlBar interact with the context. Address edge cases such as failed localStorage parsing and proper cleanup in useEffect. Provide guidance on extending the reducer with new actions while maintaining type safety with TypeScript.

wiki_catalogs.name: Interface Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the korysmiditoolbox user interface layout. Explain the purpose and functionality of each layout component: Header (export controls), ControlPanel (AI generation and export triggers), Main (primary content container), and Footer (playback controls, volume, BPM, key signature). Describe how these components are composed in index.tsx using AppProvider and ToastProvider. Illustrate with code examples from the actual implementation how state is shared across components via useApp and useToastActions hooks. Document visual design patterns including dark theme enforcement, responsive spacing, and accessibility attributes like aria-modal and role labels. Address common UI integration issues such as z-index management for modals and event propagation in nested interactive elements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Theme Customization
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for theme customization in korysmiditoolbox. Explain how the dark theme is implemented using Tailwind CSS utility classes and configured via global styles. Document the role of the SettingsPanel in toggling theme preferences and persisting user choices to localStorage. Show how theme-related state is managed within AppContext and consumed across components like Header, Footer, and ControlBar. Provide step-by-step instructions for adding custom color schemes by extending Tailwind’s theme configuration. Include practical examples from the codebase showing className manipulation with clsx and tailwind-merge utilities. Address accessibility considerations such as contrast ratios and screen reader compatibility. Offer guidance on ensuring consistent styling when introducing new UI elements that respect the active theme.

wiki_catalogs.name: AI Chord Generation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the AI Chord Generation feature of korysmiditoolbox. Explain the integration with Google's Generative AI (Gemini) API, including authentication via API key and model configuration using 'gemini-pro'. Detail the prompt engineering strategy used to generate musically coherent chord progressions based on root note and scale type. Document the structure of the AI prompt, which enforces JSON output format containing MIDI note parameters (pitch, startTime, duration, velocity). Describe the response parsing logic that extracts JSON from Gemini's text response using regex matching and handles malformed outputs. Cover validation and normalization of generated MIDI notes, including bounds checking for pitch (0-127), velocity (0-1), and timing values. Explain how chord timing is structured (2-second chords at 4-chord intervals) and how voicings are constructed (root, third, fifth, seventh) within a specified octave range (C3-C5). Include error handling procedures for invalid API keys, network issues, and malformed responses. Provide code examples from geminiService.ts showing the generateChordProgression method and updateApiKey functionality. Discuss performance considerations such as latency in AI generation and strategies for user feedback during processing. Address customization possibilities like modifying the prompt template for different musical styles or adjusting chord count and duration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for setting up the korysmiditoolbox development environment. Provide step-by-step instructions for installing Node.js 18+, cloning the repository, and running 'npm install' to install dependencies listed in package.json. Explain configuration requirements including obtaining a Google Gemini API key. Detail how to start the development server using 'npm run dev' and access the application at http://localhost:3000. Include build instructions for production using 'npm run build' and explain static site output in the 'out/' directory. Reference configuration files (next.config.ts for Next.js settings, tsconfig.json for TypeScript compilation) and their roles. Address common setup issues such as version mismatches and API key validation. Provide troubleshooting tips for dependency installation and port conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Music Theory Basics
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content on music theory concepts essential for using korysmiditoolbox effectively. Explain root notes (C, C#, D, etc.) and scale types (Major, Minor, Dorian, etc.) as defined in RootNote and ScaleType types. Describe how getScaleIntervals function maps scale types to interval patterns and enables scale snapping in the piano roll. Provide practical examples showing how selecting C Major vs A Minor affects chord generation and note validation. Document the heuristic logic in segmentNotesForPreview that classifies notes into chord, melody, bass, and arp roles based on duration and pitch distribution. Include visual examples of common chord progressions and their MIDI representations. Address user challenges in understanding modal scales and voice leading principles within the AI generation context.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive architectural documentation for the state management system using React Context API in AppContext.tsx. Explain the use of a reducer pattern with typed actions and immutable state updates to manage complex application state including MIDI notes, playback status, settings, and UI state. Detail the AppState interface and its key properties: notes array, isPlaying, currentTime, bpm, rootNote, scaleType, and appSettings. Document how dispatch actions (e.g., SET_NOTES, SET_PLAYING) are used across components to trigger state changes. Describe the integration with localStorage for persistent settings via useEffect synchronization. Explain the custom useApp hook that provides type-safe access to context throughout the component tree. Provide code examples showing state updates from user interactions in PianoRoll and ControlBar. Discuss trade-offs of using Context API versus external libraries like Redux, emphasizing bundle size and simplicity for this single-page application. Address potential scalability limitations and optimization techniques such as selective re-renders and context splitting.

wiki_catalogs.name: Gemini Service API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the geminiService class responsible for AI-powered chord progression generation. Document the generateChords method's parameters: rootNote (string) and scaleType (ScaleType), explaining valid values and musical theory implications. Specify the return type as Promise<MidiNote[]> and describe the internal process of constructing prompts for Google's Generative AI model. Detail error handling for invalid API keys, network failures, and malformed JSON responses from Gemini. Explain the HTTP request implementation using @google/generative-ai SDK with proper configuration of model parameters (temperature, maxOutputTokens). Include a code example demonstrating invocation from the UI layer with async/await pattern. Address rate limiting considerations and caching strategies to minimize redundant API calls. Document security practices for API key management via AppContext settings.

wiki_catalogs.name: Composition Workflow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the composition workflow in korysmiditoolbox. Detail the process of setting root note and scale type via dropdowns in ControlBar.tsx, triggering AI generation through handleGenerate in index.tsx, and processing the response from GeminiService. Explain how getDefaultProgression initializes default notes and how clearNotes followed by ADD_NOTE actions populate the state. Use actual code snippets to show the async/await pattern in handleGenerate, error handling with toast notifications, and dependency on state.settings.apiKey. Include best practices for prompt engineering with Gemini API and managing rate limits. Discuss music theory integration via ROOT_NOTES and SCALE_TYPES from midiUtils.ts and their mapping to MIDI pitch classes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Adding New Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for extending korysmiditoolbox with new features. Illustrate how to follow existing component patterns by creating new UI modules (e.g., EffectPanel or InstrumentSelector) that integrate with the AppContext state system. Demonstrate proper usage of custom hooks like useApp to access global state and dispatch actions. Walk through extending functionality by adding new controls to ControlBar while maintaining synchronization with playback state in audioService. Show how to register new event handlers in PianoRoll for enhanced editing capabilities. Emphasize unidirectional data flow principles and side-effect management via useEffect patterns. Provide real code examples from midiUtils.ts for reusing music theory logic. Include best practices for keeping components decoupled and testable. Address common pitfalls such as state inconsistency and prop drilling avoidance.

wiki_catalogs.name: Piano Roll Editor
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Piano Roll Editor component of korysmiditoolbox. Explain the canvas-based rendering implementation using HTML5 Canvas API for high-performance visualization of MIDI notes. Document the event handling system for mouse interactions: double-click to create notes, drag to move notes, and edge-dragging to resize note duration. Describe the visual design elements including gradient fills, rounded corners, glow effects, and selection highlighting using blue vs green color schemes. Cover the coordinate mapping system that converts screen coordinates to musical time (seconds) and pitch (MIDI number). Detail the keyboard shortcut support (Delete/Backspace to remove selected notes) and accessibility considerations. Explain the real-time playhead visualization that moves during playback, synchronized with the audio engine. Include information about the UI overlay hints that provide user guidance on interaction methods. Provide code examples from PianoRoll.tsx showing the draw() function, event handlers (handleMouseDown, handleMouseMove, etc.), and the canvas rendering pipeline. Discuss performance optimization techniques such as selective redrawing and requestAnimationFrame usage. Address common issues like pointer capture during drag operations and solutions for smooth note manipulation under various zoom levels.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Concepts
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content introducing fundamental concepts required to understand and use korysmiditoolbox effectively. Explain MIDI fundamentals including note pitch, velocity, duration, and timing resolution. Cover essential music theory concepts such as root notes, scales (major, minor, etc.), and chord progressions. Describe the application architecture based on React components, Next.js routing, and state management via Context API. Clarify how TypeScript interfaces in types/index.ts define the application's data models (AppState, MidiNote, etc.). Explain utility functions in midiUtils.ts for MIDI processing and music theory calculations. Provide practical examples showing how these concepts manifest in the UI (e.g., how scale selection affects note snapping). Include diagrams illustrating the relationship between musical theory and visual representation in the piano roll.

wiki_catalogs.name: Application Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for korysmiditoolbox's frontend architecture. Describe the React component hierarchy starting from index.tsx, through layout components, to interactive elements like PianoRoll and ControlBar. Explain the AppState interface and its role in centralizing notes, playback state, and user settings via AppContext. Illustrate data flow from user interactions (note creation, playback control) through context dispatch to service layer processing. Detail how TypeScript interfaces enforce type safety across components and services. Use sequence diagrams to show the lifecycle of an AI-generated chord progression from Gemini API call to state update and visual rendering. Discuss the advantages of Context API over alternative state management solutions for this application size and complexity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Service Layer Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed architectural documentation for the service layer design in korysmiditoolbox. Break down each service class: geminiService for AI-generated chord progressions via Google's Generative AI API, audioService for Web Audio synthesis and WAV export using Tone.js, and midiExportService for generating downloadable MIDI files via midi-writer-js. Explain how these services encapsulate business logic and external integrations while depending on the global AppState from AppContext. Document their asynchronous methods, error handling patterns, and interaction with browser APIs (fetch, Blob, OfflineAudioContext). Include usage examples such as calling generateChords() with root and scale parameters, playNote() for real-time feedback, and exportMIDI() triggering file downloads. Illustrate dependency injection via functional calls rather than DI containers. Address security considerations in client-side API key handling and performance implications of offline audio rendering. Discuss extensibility paths for adding new services like MP3 export or alternative AI providers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audio Service API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive API documentation for the audioService module that handles real-time playback and WAV export using Tone.js. Document the play() method's integration with Tone.Transport for synchronized timing, including start position based on currentTime from AppContext. Detail the stop() method's cleanup of scheduled events and transport state reset. For exportWav(), explain the offline rendering process using Tone.Offline to generate high-quality audio buffers, including sample rate configuration and promise-based completion. Describe the internal mapping of MidiNote objects to Tone.Sampler instruments with velocity-sensitive playback. Include code examples showing interaction between ControlBar component and audioService. Address performance considerations such as audio context activation requirements, memory usage during long recordings, and browser compatibility issues with Web Audio API. Provide troubleshooting tips for common issues like delayed playback and audio glitches.

wiki_catalogs.name: Piano Roll Editing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the piano roll editing experience. Explain canvas-based rendering in PianoRoll.tsx, including draw loop implementation with useCallback and useEffect dependencies. Document interaction mechanics: double-click to add notes (handleDoubleClick), drag to move (handleMouseMove with 'move' mode), resize note edges (resize-start/resize-end modes), and delete with Delete key (handleKeyDown). Describe snapping logic: snapToScale using allowedPitchClasses and snapPitchToScaleDirectional, and snapToGrid via quantizeTime with support for fine grid (Shift) and chromatic input (Alt). Illustrate with code examples how state.notes are mapped to canvas coordinates and gradients are applied for selected/unselected notes. Address performance considerations in redrawing and event handling optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Integrating Additional Services
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for integrating additional external services into korysmiditoolbox. Focus on replacing or augmenting the current AI provider (Gemini) with alternatives like OpenAI or MusicGen by implementing a standardized service interface pattern. Document the structure of geminiService.ts including its async generateChords method and error handling strategy. Show how service responses are normalized into AppState updates via context dispatchers. Explain dependency injection principles used to keep services loosely coupled from UI components. Provide implementation templates for new export services supporting MP3 or FLAC formats using libraries like lamejs or ffmpeg.wasm. Detail integration with Web Audio API extensions in audioService for advanced rendering pipelines. Include security considerations for API key management and rate limiting. Offer migration strategies for swapping out services without breaking existing functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: Audio Playback System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Audio Playback System of korysmiditoolbox. Explain the integration with Tone.js for precise scheduling of MIDI note events and real-time audio synthesis. Document the transport system that manages global playback timing, including start, stop, pause, and seek operations. Describe the synchronization between the visual playhead in the Piano Roll and the actual audio position. Cover the implementation of playback controls (play, pause, stop) in the ControlBar component and their interaction with the global application state. Detail the audio rendering pipeline, including instrument selection (likely default synth), note attack/release envelopes, and velocity-sensitive playback. Explain how the current time is updated in the AppContext and propagated to UI components. Include error handling for browser autoplay policies and audio context initialization failures. Provide code examples from audioService.ts showing the playNotes, stopPlayback, and exportToWav functions, as well as the use of Tone.Transport and Tone.OfflineRenderer for WAV export. Discuss performance considerations such as memory usage during long compositions and optimization of note scheduling for large numbers of simultaneous notes.

wiki_catalogs.name: User Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content covering end-to-end user workflows in korysmiditoolbox. Start with interface overview explaining layout components (Header, ControlPanel, Footer) and their functions. Document the composition workflow: setting root note and scale, generating AI chord progressions via Gemini API, and editing results. Detail piano roll interactions including adding notes (double-click), moving/resizing notes, and deleting selections. Explain playback controls (play, pause, stop) and visual playhead synchronization. Cover settings management including API key storage, theme toggling, and snapping preferences. Describe export functionality for both MIDI and WAV formats, including client-side file generation and download mechanisms. Use actual component code examples to illustrate behavior and provide best practices for effective music creation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow Diagrams
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed data flow documentation for korysmiditoolbox with visual diagrams and code-level explanations. Map the complete lifecycle of user interactions: from UI events (button clicks, double-click on piano roll) to action dispatches in AppContext, followed by effect-driven service invocations (e.g., playing audio or exporting files). Illustrate the real-time playback loop where requestAnimationFrame updates currentTime in state, triggering visual sync in PianoRoll. Show how AI generation flows from SettingsPanel input → geminiService.fetch → response parsing → note state update. Document side effects using useEffect hooks for audio initialization, animation frames, and localStorage persistence. Use sequence diagrams to depict interactions between components, context, and services. Highlight unidirectional data flow principles and how immutability ensures predictable state transitions. Include error propagation paths and toast notifications via ToastProvider. Emphasize timing accuracy in audio playback and synchronization challenges between visual playhead and actual tone playback.

wiki_catalogs.name: MIDI Export Service API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed API documentation for the midiExportService module responsible for generating standard MIDI files. Document the generateMidiFile() function parameters including the array of MidiNote objects, tempo (BPM), and time signature configuration. Explain the internal use of midi-writer-js library to create tracks, add note events with proper timing calculations based on quarter notes, and set track name metadata. Specify the return type as Blob (application/x-midi) suitable for browser downloads. Include a practical example showing how the SettingsPanel triggers MIDI export with user-configured options. Detail the conversion logic from absolute time (seconds) in AppState to MIDI ticks using PPQ (pulses per quarter note) resolution. Address edge cases such as empty note arrays and overlapping notes. Provide guidance on extending the service to support multiple tracks or controller messages for enhanced MIDI functionality.

wiki_catalogs.name: Playback Controls
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the audio playback system. Explain how play, pause, and stop controls in Footer.tsx dispatch SET_PLAYING and SET_CURRENT_TIME actions. Detail the animation frame loop in index.tsx that updates currentTime based on BPM (60/bpm calculation). Describe visual feedback via playhead rendering in PianoRoll.tsx when state.isPlaying is true. Cover volume control binding and its potential integration with Tone.js AudioService for actual sound output. Use code examples to show requestAnimationFrame usage, delta time calculation, and cleanup in useEffect return function. Address synchronization challenges between visual playhead and audio playback, and suggest improvements using Web Audio API timing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Export Functionality
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Export Functionality of korysmiditoolbox. Explain the two primary export formats: MIDI (.mid) and WAV (.wav). For MIDI export, document the implementation using midi-writer-js library to construct proper MIDI files with correct timing, track organization, and note grouping. Describe how the application state (notes array) is transformed into MIDI events with appropriate delta times and channel assignments. Cover metadata inclusion such as tempo and time signature if applicable. For WAV export, detail the use of Tone.js OfflineRenderer to perform non-realtime audio rendering of the composition at high quality. Explain the process of initializing the offline context, scheduling all notes, and retrieving the rendered audio buffer. Describe the conversion of audio data to WAV format and Blob creation for file download. Include information about the download triggers and filename conventions. Provide code examples from midiExportService.ts showing the generateMidiFile method and from audioService.ts showing the exportToWav function. Discuss limitations such as maximum file size for offline rendering and potential workarounds. Address common issues like incomplete downloads and browser-specific download behaviors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technical Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the korysmiditoolbox application structure. Describe the high-level design using React components organized in a hierarchy with AppContext providing global state management through a reducer pattern. Explain the service layer architecture with separation of concerns between geminiService (AI generation), audioService (Tone.js integration), and midiExportService (file generation). Document the data flow from user interaction to state update to effect-driven service calls. Illustrate component relationships and dependency injection patterns. Address technical decisions like choosing Context API over external state managers, client-side API key handling for security, and canvas-based rendering for performance. Include system context diagrams showing integration points with Google Gemini API, Web Audio API, and browser File API. Discuss scalability limitations and potential enhancement paths.

wiki_catalogs.name: Settings Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for settings management in korysmiditoolbox. Explain the SettingsPanel component's modal interface for configuring apiKey, theme, and snapping preferences. Document how updateSettings action modifies AppSettings in context and persists values to localStorage. Describe real-time toggles in the piano roll header for snapToScale and snapToGrid that call updateSettings directly. Illustrate with code examples from index.tsx how settings drive conditional behavior (e.g., apiKey validation before generation). Cover security aspects of storing API keys in localStorage and potential mitigation strategies. Address UX considerations like immediate visual feedback and error states for invalid API keys.

wiki_catalogs.name: Scale Snapping Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Scale Snapping Implementation in korysmiditoolbox. Explain the algorithmic approach that constrains note placement to valid pitches within the selected musical scale. Document the use of music theory fundamentals where each scale type (e.g., major, minor) is defined by specific interval patterns relative to the root note. Describe the allowedPitchClasses function that calculates permitted pitch classes (0-11) based on the current root note and scale type using modulo 12 arithmetic. Explain the snapPitchToScale function that finds the nearest scale-appropriate pitch when a user places a note outside the scale, searching outward up to a tritone distance. Cover the directional snapping variant (snapPitchToScaleDirectional) used during note dragging that preserves melodic direction. Detail the integration with the piano roll's quantization system and how scale snapping can be temporarily overridden with modifier keys (Alt for chromatic input). Include information about the visual feedback system where snapped notes appear in green while unsnapped would-be notes are prevented from being created. Provide code examples from PianoRoll.tsx showing the useCallback memoization of these functions and their use in getNoteFromPosition and handleMouseMove. Discuss performance considerations for real-time snapping calculations and potential optimizations for complex scales.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the internal service classes and context interfaces in korysmiditoolbox. For AppContext, document the AppState shape, dispatch actions, and custom useApp hook usage. For geminiService, detail the generateChords method parameters (rootNote, scaleType), return types, error handling, and HTTP request implementation using Google Generative AI SDK. For audioService, document play(), stop(), exportWav() methods, Tone.js transport integration, and offline rendering process. For midiExportService, document generateMidiFile() parameters and binary blob output. Include code snippets showing invocation patterns from components. Specify parameter types, return values, and exception conditions. Address rate limiting considerations with Gemini API and performance implications of audio rendering operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Export Functionality
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for file export capabilities. Detail both MIDI and WAV export flows starting from button clicks in Header and ControlPanel. For MIDI export, explain handleExportMIDI's use of MidiExportService.exportMIDI to generate Blob, createObjectURL, trigger download via anchor element injection, and revoke URL. For WAV export, cover handleExportWAV's asynchronous call to AudioService.exportWAV using offline rendering with Tone.js. Include code examples showing try/catch error handling, toast notifications for success/failure, and filename generation with timestamps. Discuss limitations of client-side rendering and browser-specific behaviors. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues like CORS restrictions or memory limits during WAV rendering.

wiki_catalogs.name: Feature-Specific Guides
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for each major feature of korysmiditoolbox. For AI Chord Generation, explain the integration with Google Gemini API, prompt engineering approach, response parsing, and validation of generated chord progressions. For the Piano Roll Editor, document the canvas-based rendering implementation, event handling for note manipulation, keyboard shortcuts, and visual feedback mechanisms. For Audio Playback, cover Tone.js scheduler integration, playhead visualization, and real-time synthesis parameters. For Export Functionality, detail MIDI file construction with proper timing and track grouping, plus WAV export using Tone.js offline rendering. For Scale Snapping, explain the algorithmic implementation in the piano roll that constrains notes to valid scale degrees. Provide optimization tips and customization possibilities for each feature.

wiki_catalogs.name: Customization and Extensibility
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content on customizing and extending korysmiditoolbox. Cover theme customization through Tailwind CSS configuration and dark mode implementation. Explain how to extend the application with new features by following existing patterns in components and services. Document integration points for additional AI providers beyond Gemini, requiring implementation of equivalent service interfaces. Describe possibilities for new export formats (MP3, FLAC) using alternative audio encoding libraries. Show how to add musical scales and modes by extending the ScaleType enum and updating validation logic. Provide guidance on implementing plugin systems for effects or instruments using Tone.js ecosystem. Include examples of modifying the UI layout by composing existing components in new ways while maintaining state consistency through AppContext.

wiki_catalogs.name: Troubleshooting
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive troubleshooting content addressing common issues users and developers encounter with korysmiditoolbox. Cover API key validation errors and network issues with Gemini API calls, including CORS considerations and quota limits. Address audio playback problems related to browser autoplay policies, Tone.js initialization, and polyfill requirements. Document MIDI export failures due to timing issues or invalid note data. Explain localStorage persistence problems and browser compatibility concerns. Provide debugging strategies using browser developer tools, console logging patterns in services, and state inspection techniques for AppContext. Include performance optimization tips for large compositions and memory management. List known limitations and workarounds for edge cases in note editing and playback synchronization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Contributing Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for developers who want to contribute to korysmiditoolbox. Detail the development setup process including required Node.js version, dependency installation, and IDE configuration for TypeScript. Explain the code style guidelines enforced by ESLint (eslint.config.mjs) and formatting rules from Prettier/postcss.config.mjs. Document testing procedures, though tests may not currently exist, suggest establishing unit and integration testing frameworks. Outline the pull request process: forking, branch creation, commit conventions, and code review expectations. Describe the build and deployment workflow using Next.js static export. Provide contribution suggestions such as improving accessibility, adding new features, or enhancing documentation. Reference existing patterns in the codebase that contributors should follow for consistency.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# Comprehensive Project Analysis: Kory's MIDI Toolbox

## 1. Project Introduction

Kory's MIDI Toolbox is a web-based music composition and production application that enables users to create, edit, and export MIDI chord progressions with AI assistance. The tool integrates Google's Gemini AI to generate musical sequences based on user-defined parameters like root note and scale type.

**Core Goals and Objectives:**
- Provide an intuitive interface for creating MIDI compositions
- Leverage AI to generate musically coherent chord progressions
- Enable both visual editing through a piano roll interface and audio playback
- Support exporting compositions in standard audio (WAV) and MIDI formats

**Target Audience:**
- Music producers and composers seeking AI-assisted inspiration
- Musicians who want to experiment with chord progressions
- Developers interested in music technology applications
- Hobbyists exploring digital music creation

Sources:
- [package.json](c:\Users\Kongo\Desktop\Apps\korysmiditoolbox\package.json)

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown

The application follows a modern React/Next.js architecture with clear separation of concerns:

- **UI Components**: Reusable visual elements organized in a component hierarchy
- **Context Management**: Global state management using React Context API
- **Services Layer**: Encapsulated business logic for audio processing, AI integration, and file export
- **Utilities**: Helper functions for MIDI manipulation and music theory calculations
- **Types**: Centralized TypeScript interfaces and types

### Design Patterns

The project implements several key design patterns:

- **Provider Pattern**: AppContext provides global state to all components
- **Service Pattern**: Dedicated service classes handle specific functionality
- **Composition Pattern**: MainApp composes multiple UI components and services
- **Event-Driven Architecture**: User interactions trigger state updates and service calls

### System Relationships

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Interface] --> B[AppContext]
    B --> C[State Management]
    A --> D[Services]
    D --> E[Gemini AI API]
    D --> F[Tone.js Audio Engine]
    D --> G[MIDI Writer Library]
    C --> H[LocalStorage]
    D --> I[File Export]
```

### Data Flow

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[User Input] --> B[UI Components]
    B --> C[AppContext Dispatch]
    C --> D[State Update]
    D --> E[Effect Handlers]
    E --> F[Service Calls]
    F --> G[External APIs/Libraries]
    G --> H[Data Processing]
    H --> I[State Update]
    I --> J[UI Re-render]
```

- [AppContext.tsx](c:\Users\Kongo\Desktop\Apps\korysmiditoolbox\src\context\AppContext.tsx)

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `src/pages/index.tsx` - Primary application entry point
- `src/pages/_app.tsx` - Next.js custom App component

### Core Modules
- `src/context/AppContext.tsx` - Central state management
- `src/services/geminiService.ts` - AI-powered chord generation
- `src/services/audioService.ts` - Audio playback and WAV export
- `src/services/midiExportService.ts` - MIDI file generation
- `src/components/PianoRoll.tsx` - Visual music editor

### Configuration Approach
- `next.config.ts` - Next.js configuration with static export enabled
- `tsconfig.json` - TypeScript configuration with path aliases
- `package.json` - Dependency management and scripts

### External Dependencies
- `@google/generative-ai` - For AI-generated chord progressions
- `tone` - Web Audio framework for playback and rendering
- `midi-writer-js` - For generating MIDI files
- `next`, `react`, `react-dom` - Core frontend framework

### Integration Points
- Google Generative AI API for music generation
- Web Audio API via Tone.js for playback
- Browser File API for download functionality
- LocalStorage for persistent user settings

### Component Relationship Diagram

```mermaid
graph LR
    A[MainApp] --> B[Header]
    A --> C[ControlPanel]
    A --> D[Footer]
    A --> E[PianoRoll]
    A --> F[SettingsPanel]
    A --> G[AppContext]
    A --> H[GeminiService]
    A --> I[AudioService]
    A --> J[MidiExportService]
    G --> K[State Management]
    H --> L[AI Generation]
    I --> M[Audio Playback]
    J --> N[MIDI Export]
```

- [audioService.ts](c:\Users\Kongo\Desktop\Apps\korysmiditoolbox\src\services\audioService.ts)
- [midiExportService.ts](c:\Users\Kongo\Desktop\Apps\korysmiditoolbox\src\services\midiExportService.ts)
- [PianoRoll.tsx](c:\Users\Kongo\Desktop\Apps\korysmiditoolbox\src\components\PianoRoll.tsx)

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
- **AI-Powered Chord Generation**: Generate chord progressions using Google's Gemini AI
- **Piano Roll Editor**: Visual interface for editing MIDI notes
- **Real-time Playback**: Listen to compositions with synchronized playhead
- **Multi-format Export**: Download as MIDI or WAV files
- **Scale Snapping**: Automatic alignment to selected musical scales
- **Persistent Settings**: User preferences saved to localStorage

### Implementation Highlights
- Dynamic chord progression generation based on musical theory
- Interactive canvas-based piano roll with drag-and-drop editing
- Real-time audio rendering using Tone.js
- Precise MIDI timing and quantization
- Responsive UI with dark theme optimization

### Feature Architecture Diagram

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> Generating: Click "Generate"
    Generating --> Processing: Call Gemini API
    Processing --> Success: Receive Chord Progression
    Processing --> Error: API Failure
    Success --> Playing: Click "Play"
    Playing --> Paused: Click "Pause"
    Paused --> Playing: Click "Resume"
    Playing --> Stopped: Click "Stop"
    Stopped --> Exporting: Click "Export"
    Exporting --> MIDI: Export MIDI
    Exporting --> WAV: Export WAV
    MIDI --> Idle: Download Complete
    WAV --> Idle: Download Complete
    Error --> Idle: Dismiss Error
```

- [index.tsx](c:\Users\Kongo\Desktop\Apps\korysmiditoolbox\src\pages\index.tsx)

- [midiExportService.ts](c:\Users\Kongo\Desktop\Apps\korysmiditoolbox\src\services\midiExportService.ts)
</blog>
